Chapter 5 Quick workflow 5.1 Importing data Lets get started with importing our raw data into R. The easiest way is to use the import_files() function. Its purpose is to read any kind of raw data and store it in the .imports list. If no argument is supplied for files, the function opens a separate window to manually specify the file/s. new_dataset(import = .imports[["Hjv_proteomics_DEN_proteinGroups"]], name = "DEN", identifier = "Protein.IDs" , data.types = c("Gene.names", "Protein.names", "LFQ.intensity", "Only.identified.by.site", "Potential.contaminant", "Reverse")) h
